intro: Daphnopsis caribaea var. peruviensis, commonly known as the Peruvian daphnopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant typically features dense, leathery leaves that are dark green in color and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
